title: Why does Riot like to make new champs manly while set them to be females?
body:
Kalista, Rek sai. Manly appearance with female voices. It just feels wired. Why not give them beatiful girly pretty shape if you wanna have female champs???

Please do not make Ao Shin female! He is a facking handsome boy!

replies.body:
Can you expect Kalista, torn by who knows what and death to think "You know what, I should take care of my appearance a bit better"?
And seriously, why should any woman have to be woried about their appearances?
One question, how is Kalista (or even Rek Sai for that matter) 'manly'? They are merely portrayed as non-human, can't expect all non-humans to be as sexually appealing as, say, Kat or Janna.
Fap to hentai, not LoL loading screens.

So apparently the only way to portray women is as a nearly-naked plant woman or a lady parading around Summoner's Rift in a spider costume?

Because if you can't see cleavage, it's obviously a male.
Because Kalista is undead and Rek'Sai is a sand shark? If you want them made hot go screw a rotting fish.
Yeah, Rek Sai should ooze with ___ appeal lol.

I don't see why we should conform with gender stereotypes that religiously. Same thing applies to guys, hence Riot now isn't just releasing all males to be muscle freaks like how they used to for nearly every guy champ.

Varying things up a bit is always fun to have.

Plus we have Ezreal and Taric (and a bunch of yordles), can't really hurt to have some female champs who don't match the social expectations can it?

Not to mention your examples, one is pretty much a banshee of some sort and the other isn't even close to being a human, no reason to specifically use human standards.

Who says females can't be badarse, hateful, or whatever though? Well in real world there are some factors that limit these options, but this is a fantasy world we're talking about, so it really shouldn't matter. Let the artist/designer/whoever decide what they want, creative freedom.
because they're sick of womyn complaining about champs being sexualised or something, who %%%%ing knows.
